intro: Tofieldia calyculata subsp. capitata, commonly known as the clustered tofieldia, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a member of the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear yellowish-green flowers, which are typically short-lived. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of ponds. This subspecies is noted for its ecological importance in supporting local insect populations.
